entry.title: Re: SAP Build Process Automation - How to get currectUser...
entry.content:
Hi izni,

the username you see (the secret code) is actually the global user ID of the user, who started the workflow.

It is part of IAS user setup.

IAS can be setup to have other values as Global user ID, or example the email could be used.

However it will anyway not solve your requirement, as it is the user ID of the user who started the flow, not the currently logged on user.

To get this, you must use some BTP user info API, or IAS API. I think this is tricky, haven't solved it myself yet.

Johannes

entry.title: Cannot access F1273 as well as F6748(CBC)
entry.content:
Premise:
Two individuals, A and B, accessed the application, but only B was able to access it.
At this time, A has all the permissions that B has, and also has more permissions than B.
Additionally, no particular restrictions are set for each role.
The timing when the error began: During "Manage Business Role Changes After Upgrade," multiple business roles were viewing the same business role template, and only one was retained while the others were deleted. Users assigned to the deleted roles were reassigned to the remaining business role. This impact is affecting user A more than B.

Question
Some users cannot access CBC apps like  Automatic Account Determination (F1273) and Define Financial Statement Versions in Global Hierarchies (F6748).
Please tell me the possible causes and solutions.

entry.title: Re: Marketplace App Deployment & Lifecycle Management Usi...
entry.content: Using SAP DevOps tools for marketplace app deployment and lifecycle management helps streamline development, deployment, and maintenance. With automated CI/CD pipelines, apps can be tested, deployed, and updated efficiently across SAP environments. Tools like SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD) and SAP Cloud Platform Transport Management enable version control, automated testing, and monitoring throughout the app lifecycle. This ensures faster releases, reduced errors, and smooth updates, while maintaining compliance and performance standards in marketplace applications.

entry.title: MRP Planning Issue
entry.content:
Hi all,

There is a unique business requirement where the finished material should not be planned (MRP Type â€“ ND), but its dependent materials should still be planned (MRP Type â€“ PD).

Hereâ€™s the scenario:

  • When a sales order is created for the finished material, the requirement should appear in MD04.
  • The system should plan the dependent materials accordingly.

However, when we maintain MRP Type as ND for the finished material and create a sales order, the schedule line category defaults to CN (No planning), which makes sense â€” but in this case, the sales order is not visible in MD04.

Now, in transaction VOV5, thereâ€™s an option to maintain the schedule line category.
If we manually assign schedule line category CP, will the demand be visible in MD04?
And if it is visible, will the dependent materials (with MRP Type PD) be planned accordingly?

If not, Iâ€™m looking for a workaround that can meet this requirement â€” where the finished material itself isnâ€™t planned, but its components are.

Appreciate any inputs or experiences from the community.

Thanks & Regards,
T. Hemant Kumar

entry.title: Receipt from Production (Final Product Price not calculated)
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are using SAP B1 v.10 and we have setup non perpetual inventory .

Everything works as expected as far as the last evaluation price is concernerd apart from the production module.

Specifiacally, we implement the following steps:

1. We issue the components of the production order (Issue for production)

2. We receive the final product (Receipt from production)

3. We run the Inventory Audit report for the final product

4. The last evaluated price remains blank

5. We close the production order and run again the Inventory Audit report.

6. The last evaluated price remains blank once again.

Any suggestions on what might be wrong?

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: SuccessFactors 2H2025 Release: Enhancements to Dependent Information Importing You Need to Know
entry.content:
The enhancements in the second half of 2025 bring change, excitement, and often discomfort. For consultants, it means extended hours of analysis and extensive testing.

As we prepared for our analysis and customer release presentations, the enhancement "A Dependent Can Only Be Linked to One Employee'' had captured our attention.   

Organizations frequently have employees who share the same dependents, and these relationships are displayed on their profiles. The new validation will prevent imports attempting to link a dependent to more than one employee unless the specified method is followed.

After reviewing the Release notes, we noticed the SAP Note:

If you still wish to link the same dependent to multiple employees, you can create multiple persons for this dependent in the system.

Let's test this!

Scenario: We have an existing dependent who is assigned to an employee in the organisation.  We want to link the same dependent to another employee.

Employee with an existing dependent.

Problem:

Prior to 2H2025, to assign this dependent to another employee, we were able to link this dependent using the Personal Relationship import using the existing person-id-external field.

Using the existing person-id-external for this import after the release will result in an error.

Solution: Starting in 2H2025, the following steps must be implemented using a new external person ID for the dependent.

1. Prepare, Validate, and Import Biographical Info import file

Creating a new person-id-external for the dependent is mandatory.

2. Prepare, Validate, and Import Personal Relationships import file

Dependent is now linked to the second employee.

3. Prepare, Validate, and Import Personal Information

Imports for National ID, Address Info can be imported using the same process once the above steps are completed.

An enhanced validation has also been introduced which ensure dependent's Personal Information records and Address Information records are aligned with the start date of the dependent's Person Relationship records.

After our review and analysis of the 2H2025 release notes, we have identified necessary validations, enhancements, and UI changes. ðŸ˜Š Let's continue exploring, reading, and as always, monitor the 2H2025 Known Issues!

Thanks for reading!

Ashlin

Dear customer,
I kindly ask you to create a customer ticket using component BC-DWB-TOO-ATF

Please provide detailed information to reproduce the issue, such as what were your steps in detail, did any errors appear, etc.

Please also provide the Support.zip file. For creation, choose Help > Collect Support Information... from the menu.

For further information, see here: 1745015 - Providing Information for ADT to SAP Support
https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/1745015

Which ADT client version do you use? See Help > About ABAP Development Tools from the menu.
You can find the latest client  on: https://tools.hana.ondemand.com/#abap

Thank you for your help.

Kind regards,
Wolfgang

entry.title: How to Bulk Modify Calendar Event Context Filters Using Scripting
entry.content:
The Calendar in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) is a powerful framework for orchestrating planning processes, tasks, and workflows across teams. Each calendar event or process carries context filters â€” such as Date, Version, or Proficenter etc. â€” that define the specific slice of data being worked on by a team or user.

In some cases, administrators or power users may need to update these context filters in bulk, for example when moving from one fiscal year to another.

While this can be done manually using the Calendar List workspace (where multiple events can be selected and edited together), alternatively scripting provides a faster, automated way to achieve the same â€” especially when you need to apply changes dynamically.

This approach is inspired by the SAP Community blog written by @mike688 
Experience Sharing â€“ How to Batch Modify the Assignees of Calendar Events Using Scripting in SAC, which demonstrates how to modify event assignees in bulk using the Calendar Integration API.

In this post, we extend the same idea â€” but instead of assignees, we modify dimension context filters for multiple events at once.

Option 1 â€“ Editing Multiple Events via the SAC UI

You can update context filters directly using the Calendar List workspace:

Steps:

  1. Navigate to Calendar â†’ List workspace.

  2. Select multiple events that you want to modify.

  3. Click Edit Events.

  1. Choose Context, and update filters such as Date, Version, or Category.

This method works well for manual batch updates, especially when the changes are straightforward and performed occasionally.For detailed reference, see SAPâ€™s documentation: Editing Multiple Calendar Events at Once

Option 2 â€“ Automating Context Filter Updates Using Scripting

The Calendar Integration API in SAC allows developers to access and modify multiple calendar tasks and processes programmatically.

You can learn more about this API and its supported operations in the official documentation: SAP Help â€“ Calendar Event API Reference

Below is an example that demonstrates how to batch modify Date context filters for all child events of a process. You can also modify the same script to change other dimension context filters also.

Example Scenario

Suppose your planning calendar has multiple child tasks for FY2022.
You now want to update all these tasks to FY2025 automatically.

Step 1:  Accessing the EventID of a Process

To view the event ID of an event, go to the Event Settings dialog and choose Show Details. 

Step 2: Create a story and add the below code to the story widget.

Prerequisite: Add a Calendar Integration Technical Object

Then, paste the following script:

 

// Step 1: Get main process event
//Replace XXXXXXX with Process Event ID.
var root = CalendarIntegration_1.getCalendarEventById("XXXXXXXXXXXXX");

if (root === undefined) {
    Application.showMessage(ApplicationMessageType.Warning, "Invalid event ID.");
    Application.hideBusyIndicator();
    return;
}

// Step 2: Check event type
if (root.getType() !== CalendarTaskType.Process) {
    Application.showMessage(ApplicationMessageType.Warning, "Only Process type events can be modified.");
    Application.hideBusyIndicator();
    return;
}

// Step 3: Get children
var process = cast(Type.CalendarProcess, root);
var childIds = process.getChildren();

console.log("Child event IDs:");
console.log(childIds);

var targetYear = "2025"; // Enter Target new year for the child event 

// Step 4: Loop through each childs
for (var i = 0; i < childIds.length; i++) {
    var childId = childIds[i];
    console.log("Processing child ID"+childId);

    var ev = CalendarIntegration_1.getCalendarEventById(childId);
    if (ev === undefined) {
        console.log("Skipping invalid child->"+childId);
		       continue;
    }

    // Step 5: Get context filters
    var ctx = ev.getContextFilters();
    console.log("Context filters for child:");
    console.log(ctx);

    // We canâ€™t assign null â†’ use flag and index instead
    var hasDateFilter = false;
    var dateFilterIndex = -1;

    for (var j = 0; j < ctx.length; j++) {
        var f = ctx[j];
        if (f.members && f.members.length > 0 && f.members[0].dimensionId === "Date") {
            hasDateFilter = true;
            dateFilterIndex = j;
            break;
        }
    }

    if (hasDateFilter === false) {
        console.log("No Date filter found for"+childId);
        continue;
    }

    var dateFilter = ctx[dateFilterIndex];
console.log("datefilter");
	console.log(dateFilter);
    // Step 6: Remove old Date filter for the child event
    var removed = ev.removeContextFilter(dateFilter);
    if (removed === true) {

		console.log("Removed old Date filter for -> " + childId);

    } else {
        //console.log("Could not remove Date filter for:", childId);
        continue;
    }

    // Step 7: Build new Date filter dynamically
    var modelId = dateFilter.members[0].modelId;
    var hierarchy = dateFilter.hierarchy;

	var newDateFilter = ArrayUtils.create(Type.CalendarContextFilter); 
			

	newDateFilter = [{
    hierarchy: {
        id: "FYQP",
        description: "FYQP"
    },
    members: [
        {
            dimensionId: "Date",
            id: "[Date].[FYQP].[Date.FISCAL_YEAR].[" + targetYear + "]",
            description: targetYear,
            displayId: targetYear,
            modelId: modelId
        }
    ]
}];

    // Step 8: Add the new Date filter
  ev.addContextFilter(newDateFilter[0]);
  console.log("Added new Date filter (" + targetYear + ") for" + childId);
}

// Step 9: Done
Application.showMessage(ApplicationMessageType.Success, "Date context filters updated successfully for all child events!");
Application.hideBusyIndicator();

 

API Methods Used

MethodPurpose
getCalendarEventById()Fetches a specific event using its ID
getChildren()Retrieves all child events under a process
getContextFilters()Returns all context filters for the event
removeContextFilter()Removes an existing context filter
addContextFilter()Adds a new context filter dynamically

Summary

The Calendarevent API in SAP Analytics Cloud provides a rich set of methods that go well beyond modifying context filters.
You can reuse the same structure to perform a variety of automation and maintenance actions across the planning calendar events.

By combining UI-based editing and scripting automation, SAC administrators can achieve both flexibility and efficiency in managing planning calendars.

entry.title: Re: B1SLayer: A clean and easy way to consume SAP Business One Service Layer with .NET
entry.content:
Hi Bruno,

I'm trying to upload attachments and getting a error -43 and inner exception in 400 bad request. could you help me on this?

 collection is IFormCollection

try
 {
     var fileStreams = new Dictionary<string, byte[]>();

     foreach (var formFile in collection.Files)
     {
         if (formFile.Length > 0)
         {
             // Copy file stream
             var memoryStream = new MemoryStream();
             await formFile.CopyToAsync(memoryStream);
             memoryStream.Position = 0; // Reset position for reading

             fileStreams.Add(string.Concat(Guid.NewGuid().ToString().Substring(0,5),"_",formFile.FileName.Replace(" ","")), memoryStream.ToArray());
         }
     }

     SLAttachment sLAttachment = await ServiceLayer.Connection.PostAttachmentsAsync(fileStreams);
     attchmentEntry = sLAttachment.AbsoluteEntry.ToString();


     
 }
 catch (Exception ex)
 {

     return new JsonResult(new { success = false, error = ex.Message });
 }

entry.title: Re: How do I configure a custom sales workflow in SAPâ€¯Sal...
entry.content:
Hi Suheb,

To automate in SAP Sales Cloud that, after 30 days, an opportunity automatically moves to the next sales phase or triggers the creation of a task, you need to create a scheduled (time-based) workflow rule. This rule can be based directly on the creation date or on a custom date-type field that controls when the action should be executed. In the first case, you simply define the condition â€œcreation date + 30 daysâ€ and configure the action to either update the sales phase or create a task for the responsible user. In the second, more flexible approach, you can create a custom field such as â€œNext Action Date,â€ which is automatically updated (via workflow) with the current date plus 30 days each time the opportunity changes phase or is modified; then, a scheduled workflow rule is created so that when the date in that field is reached, it executes the corresponding action to update the phase or create a task.

Best regards,
Fernando

entry.title: Re: SAP Integration Content API - Is it possible to view all process direct endpoint value
entry.content:
Hi!

I need the same functionality: a list of all ProcessDirect endpoints alongside their corresponding iFlow names. Did you find a solution to your problem? Unfortunately, the /ServiceEndpoints API doesn't provide ProcessDirect endpoints. From my perspective, you could do the following:

  • Get all packages with the /IntegrationPackages API.
  • For each package, retrieve the list of all artefacts: /IntegrationPackages('MyPackage')/IntegrationDesignTimeArtifacts.
  • For each iFlow artefact, download the content: /IntegrationDesignTimeArtifacts(Id="MyIFlow", Version="active")/$value.
  • Unzip the content and read the file: src/main/resources/parameters.propdef.
  • Select all entries from the node: <param_references> where the attribute_id contains ProcessDirect.
<param_references> where the attribute_id contains ProcessDirect.
<reference attribute_category="Sender1" attribute_id="ctype::Adapter/cname::ProcessDirect/vendor::SAP/version::1.1.2/attrId::address" attribute_uilabel="Address" param_key="address"/>â€‹
  • You can fetch the endpoint, which relates to the attribute param_key, from the file: src/main/resources/parameters.prop.
#
Tue Sep 09 13:24:51 UTC 2025 
address=/myEndpoint
â€‹
  • Alternatively, use the API /IntegrationDesignTimeArtifacts(Id="MyIFlow",Version="active")/Configurations and search for the parameter key with the same value as param_key.
"ParameterKey": "address",
"ParameterValue": "/myEndpoint",â€‹

I could not find an easier solution.

entry.title: Develop Full-Stack ABAP Applications in SAP Business Application Studio
entry.content:
The SAP Business Application Studio provides several extensions designed to streamline the development of business applications for the SAP Intelligent Enterprise.

Among these extensions is the CDS Graphical Modeler, which enables SAP business developers to visually design Core Data Service (CDS) models. Previously, this extension was available for SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) development projects.

However, with the release of SAP BTP ABAP environment 2508 and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, corresponding to ABAP release 9.16, we have integrated the CDS Graphical Modeler with ABAP. This integration allows developers to create ABAP projects using the CDS Graphical Modeler to conveniently design ABAP-compliant CDS models for various scenarios in a remote ABAP system.

Ultimately, you can now build full-stack ABAP applications in SAP Business Application Studio. Once you've created an ABAP project, you can model business objects, generate ABAP CDS artifacts, integrate a user interface, and deploy your application to the appropriate environments, such as SAP BTP ABAP environment or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Curious how this works? Check out our documentation on SAP Help Portal for detailed instructions: Develop Full-Stack ABAP Applications in SAP Business Application Studio.

But youâ€™re short on time or just looking for a quick peek? Keep reading! ðŸ˜‰

1. Set Up Your Full-Stack ABAP Project:

In the SAP Build Lobby, choose Create right above the project list and select Create from the drop-down menu. This opens the Create Project dialog.

Project creation screen with options for Application, Automated Process, and Business Site, highlighting Application with a "Next" button.

In the Create Project dialog, select Application, click Next, select Full-Stack, advance with Next, and finally select Full-Stack ABAP (SAP Business Application Studio).

"Full-Stack ABAP (SAP Business Application Studio)" option is selected for creating a project with a "Next" button available.

Advance with Next and specify the target ABAP system and configure the project details.
Once the project is created, a Core Schema Notation Model is created in the remote ABAP system, and the remote ABAP package path is added to the workspace. The project then opens in the Storyboard.

2. Model Your Application:

From the Storyboard, you can model your ABAP application using the CDS Graphical Modeler to define and visualize your ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP) business objects, projections, and services relevant to your application development.

Storyboard offers options to create a business object, projection, service, or UI application with corresponding plus buttons.

 Choose + in the Create an entity field to add the business object entities and define their relationship for the business service.

Note: Next to the Business Object modeler, you see your CSN file. This file resides on your ABAP system in the package you created previously. This file is used by the modeler to store your model. You should not edit this file manually since this can damage the integrity of the model.

Proceed with adding projections to specify which elements of a business object are exposed in the business service.

Add a business service and select which entities to expose in the service.

Storyboard shows the relation of business objects, projections, and services and an option to create a new UI application.

You are now all set to generate the ABAP backend artefacts from the modeled business objects, projections, and services. Close the Business Services modeler and return to the Storyboard.

3. Generate ABAP CDS Artifacts:

Once you have modeled your ABAP application, you need to generate the ABAP development objects based on the data model created with the CDS Graphical Modeler, including DDIC tables, CDS views, metadata extensions, and service definitions.

From the Storyboard, choose Generate and follow the steps in the wizard to perform validation checks and complete the generation process.
As a result, a read-only RAP OData UI service is generated and available in the service catalog. On the ABAP side, the development objects are activated, and the service binding is published.

4. Add a User Interface and Deploy Your Application:

As a last step, you need to create a user interface for your RAP service by generating a SAP Fiori UI application that you can then deploy to an appropriate environment, such as SAP BTP ABAP Environment or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

From the Storyboard, choose + in the UI Applications field to open the SAP Fiori Generator wizard and provide the required inputs for your UI development. To deploy the application, choose Deploy from the Application Information tab.

 

And that's it! You've successfully developed a full-stack ABAP application in SAP Business Application Studioâ€”quickly and effortlessly in just a few steps.

What do you think of it? We would love to hear your thoughts! Share your feedback in the comments below.

entry.title: Recurring Inspection Lot error in SAP QM
entry.content:

entry.title: Re: SAP Error-Incorrect "Qty (Inventory UoM)" in line 15;...
entry.content:
Dear ,

You can use the below update query to fix the issue 

SELECT * FROM OITM WHERE "TreeType"<>'N' and "ItemCode" not in (select "Code" from OITT);

UPDATE OITM SET "TreeType"='N' where "TreeType"<>'N' and "ItemCode" not in (select "Code" from OITT);

Regards,

Prince Ebi

entry.title: Re: Purchase requisition creation (STO) from Sales order

entry.title: Re: Group reporting + data collection + SAC - SAP Public...
entry.content:
Hi,

Think it might be difficult for you.

In Public Cloud you are not able to create additional chart of accounts. All your 15 clients would have the same Y1 standard. You will be able to create additional FS items but with 15 different clients... 

You will be able to create multiple versions, one for each client, to separate transactional data access but you need to be strict with your naming convention to create a close to viable authorization setup.

For GRDC you will have only 1. There can only be one connected GRDC. This means all input forms are shared: client 1 can look and change the layout of client 2. You don't authorize on individual forms or folders but on access to the Fiori tile.

Then if you have that the client will have super admin users and perhaps someone to maintain users and roles these you might have difficulties restricting not to have any access between your clients.

I can see you properly have some hosting revenue but you might  be better of recommending each of your clients to have their own public cloud.

Br

Martin Jul

entry.title: Re: 2H_2025 | Global Assignment | Application error
entry.content:
Hi,

Currently, we do have a defect regarding add a Global Assignment for users with dependents which has been documented in the below KBA
https://me.sap.com/notes/0003677647 The workaround is as below:
Workaround:
       1.Please import the Global Assignments via Import Employee data.
       2.Enable the field "is-accompanying-dependent" under Dependents Information in Manage Business Configuration.
You can follow up on this KBA for any updates related to code correction However, if your issue is not related to dependents then you can raise a ticket to SAP for investigation, thanks.

Best regards,

Elsa

entry.title: ðŸ‡°ðŸ‡¼ Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core (Kuwait)
entry.content:
In this SAP CodeJam, you will learn how to use Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core to implement a retrieval augmented generation (RAG) use case to improve the responses of large language models (LLMs) and reduce hallucinations. You will learn how to work with LLMs and the orchestration service on SAP AI Core and query it via SAP AI Launchpad and the Python SDK. Furthermore, you will learn about the most important genAI concepts and create and use embeddings to improve your RAG response and build your own chatbot with memory. 

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Monday, December 8, 2025, at Kuwait University, University Administration Building, Sabah al-Salem, Academic City, from 10:00 to 16:00 local time.

The binding registration for this event is via the form: https://forms.office.com/e/nCj7stjw4g  

The event's language and content will be in English. 

Prerequisites: Bring your own laptop with a Chromium-based web browser, such as Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, etc.

Please note that spaces are limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis.

entry.title: Re: Professional service Projects
entry.content:
Hello @sanne_larsen 

Thank you for your question.

You can consult the following references for further details.

Blogs: 4E9-New Project Billing Configuration and Process, Project Billing for Customer Projects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Professional Services in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition 2302

Links: Event-Based Revenue Recognition for Fixed Price Service Orders

Customer Projects with Event-Based Revenue Recognition

To summarise, in public cloud, the choice between Periodic Service and Fixed Price Service projects defines how and when your revenue is recognised.

  • If you have ongoing subscription-type engagements (e.g., managed services), where your revenue is recognised periodically based on elapsed time or incurred costs, then Periodic Service will be the ideal solution for you.
  • However, if you are focused on project-based engagements, where the revenue is recognised based on every achieved milestone or upon fulfilment of specific deliverables, then Fixed Price Service is the better fit.

If your customerâ€™s business is shifting toward deliverable-based billing, you should define new projects where you use the Fixed Price Service setup. However, both models can also coexist if you segment your project billing items appropriately.

Manage Project Billing (helps you check contract type) and Run Revenue Recognition (helps you simulate accounting results) can help you review and simulate revenue timing

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Outlook for 2602 - 'AI-assisted permit management'
entry.content:
The 'AI-assisted permit management' innovation will help an Environmental Manager by significantly accelerating and simplifying the process of handling environmental permits. The process works in three main steps:
1. Import & Setup: The manager will import the environmental permit as a PDF document into the system.
2. Header Identification: The AI will automatically detect header information from the document's first page to help set up the permit's general data in the system.
3. Requirement Extraction & Task Proposal: The AI will extract compliance requirements from the permit text and automatically proposes corresponding operational tasks, such as data collection or reporting.

With the help of this innovation the manager will be able to review, accept, or deny these proposed tasks. This reduces manual effort, minimizes human error, lowers operational costs, and helps ensure compliance to avoid potential penalties. Stay tuned for the 2602 release!

entry.title: How to customize push notification payload to send additional data from s/4 to SSAM
entry.content:
Currently in the standard push notification feature for SAP Service and Asset Manager, only the object key of particular object like Notification number for Notification and Order Id for Work Order is sent to mobile device in push notification payload. Sample payload

{"notification":{"alert":"{\"title-loc-key\":\"NOTIF_TITLE_KEY\",\"title-loc-args\": [\"1000000000\"],\"loc-key\":\"NOTIF_BODY_KEY\",\"loc-args\": [\"1000000000\"]}","data":"{\"ObjectType\":\"Notification\",\"ObjectID\":\"1000000000\"}"}

But we want to show additional details in the push notification message like notification description and technical object description. We found the exact method which generates the payload. Class /MFND/CL_CORE_OTRIG_CPMS_PUSH  and method is BUILD_JSON_DATA.

But in this method, we are only able to get Object Key (Notification Number) and no other data. Also we are not able to fetch relevant data from table as notification is not yet saved.

Does anyone knows how we can handle this situation and how to send additional data like Technical object description in this payload.

entry.title: API Execution Failed When Trying to Use â€œTry Outâ€ Feature in SAP Cloud Integration API on BTP Trial
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I recently ran into an issue while experimenting with SAP Cloud Integration on my SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Trial Account, and I wanted to share my experience here in case anyone else has faced something similarâ€”or if someone can point me in the right direction.

Scenario

As part of my learning journey in SAP Integration Suite, I created an Integration Flow (iFlow) in Cloud Integration (CPI) and successfully deployed it.

Then, I exposed the iFlow as an API through the API Management capability of BTP so that I could access it externally via a REST API call.

Everything went smoothly until I tried to test the API using the â€œTry Outâ€ feature from SAP API Business Hub.

Steps Followed

  1. Logged in to my SAP BTP Trial account.

  2. Opened Integration Suite â†’ Cloud Integration.

  3. Created and deployed an iFlow that returns some sample data.

  4. Exposed the iFlow as an API Proxy using API Management â†’ Design â†’ API Proxies.

  5. Opened the Cloud Integration API package on SAP API Business Hub.

  6. Clicked â€œTry Outâ€ to test one of the APIs (for example, /MessageProcessingLogs).

  7. Given the clientid and clientsecret from instance default_it-rt_integration-flow and also I tried with my BTP sign inuser id and password and it shows API execution failed. Please try again.

    Issue Facing

    When I clicked Execute, the system returned the following message:

    API execution failed. Please try again.

    No additional error details were displayed in the response window, and the API call did not reach my iFlow endpoint.

    Troubleshooting Attempted

    Hereâ€™s what Iâ€™ve tried so far:

    • Verified that the iFlow is deployed and active.

    • Checked the runtime URL from the Monitor â†’ Manage Integration Content page.

    • Verified that my trial tenant is active and not in suspended state.

    • Checked API Business Hub â€œTry Outâ€ feature for other packages â€” same issue occurs, which might indicate an environment limitation.

      My Understanding So Far

      It seems that the â€œTry Outâ€ feature on SAP API Business Hub might not support BTP Trial environments for certain APIs, especially those requiring authenticated connections to Cloud Integration runtime.

      In a productive BTP setup (non-trial), the â€œTry Outâ€ function usually works fine when proper credentials and destinations are configured.

      Request for Help

      Has anyone successfully used the Cloud Integration API â€œTry Outâ€ feature with a Trial account?
      If so, could you please share:

      • Any specific configuration or destination settings needed for trial accounts

      • Whether OAuth token-based authentication is mandatory

      • Or if this limitation is by design for BTP Trial users

        Conclusion

        Iâ€™m learning a lot about SAP Integration Suite and the API Management capabilities on BTP.
        Even though Iâ€™ve hit this roadblock, itâ€™s been a great opportunity to understand how authentication and API exposure work behind the scenes in the SAP ecosystem.

        Would love to hear from the community if anyone has faced and resolved this issue! ðŸ™Œ

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Release for Product Compli...
entry.content: The SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release for Product Compliance significantly enhances the compliance process by providing continuous content delivery for product marketability and safety data sheet requirements through the SAP Regulatory Content Service. This innovation decouples regulatory updates from the traditional software release cycle, allowing companies to receive the latest rule sets as soon as they are released. It ensures that businesses can promptly adapt to new compliance rules, mitigating the risks of shipment stops, fines, and market access issues associated with delays in regulatory adoption. For further information check out my blog post.

entry.title: Re: Effortless SAPUI5 Patch Management: Introducing the New SAPUI5 Runtime Repository
entry.content:
@Marian_Zeis 
Yes for the bootstrap URLs. The minUI5Version would only affect FLP.

I can't provide more details here, as this goes too far into the future and nothing is nailed in stone. It is also too much for the scope of this post.
These are just my personal thoughts:
In general it is not a good idea to specify the major version for the whole system. It can't be expected that every single app on the system is always compatible. There must be migration paths with time windows over several years. This can only be an app decision which version is supported and FLP must act on this.

entry.title: Auto Top N sort order mismatch in SAC optimized story
entry.content:
Hello Community,

â– Environmentï¼š
ã€€SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Optimized Story Experience

â– Problem / Phenomenonï¼š
ã€€Phenomenon: Automated Top N Sort Order Mismatch
ã€€I am using the Optimized Story Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).

ã€€When a chart's dimension members exceed the visualization limit, the Automatic Top N filter is applied by the system as expected.

ã€€However, the resulting sort order of this automatically applied Top N (e.g., Top 10) does not align with the sort order of a manually configured Descending Sort (on a bar chart) or a Manual Top N filter.


ã€€In short, the automated Top N function appears to be using a sort criterion other than the core measure, leading to inconsistent results across charts.

â– Details and Verification Resultsï¼š
The analysis uses the following structure:

Dimension: [Dimension01] (114 unique members)
Measure: [measure01]


As shown in the attached image, the Automatic Top N result is inconsistent with the results from the Manual Top N and the Table Chart (All Data Sorted Descending by Measure01).


â– Verification Steps:

Verification 1: The manual sort using Measure01 matches the "All Data" Table/Bar Chart result.

Verification 2: We confirmed that the Automatic Top N is NOT sorting based on our intended measure (Measure01).

Verification 3: We created a separate table to verify the Record Count (Count of Records) for each member, and the Automatic Top N is NOT sorting by Record Count either.

Verification 4: No Top N or Rank filter is visible in the Builder/Filter panel of the automatically restricted chart.

â– Specific Questionï¼š

Given that the sort order does not match either Measure01 or the number of records, what criteria (what sort order) does the automatic Top N function in SAC's optimized stories use to perform the default sorting?

Is the system referencing a hidden default measure or an internal sort mechanism that is not accessible to the user? Knowing the criteria is essential for understanding the data presented.

If anyone knows about this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: Re: Browser Access not working from user system (same net...
entry.content:
Check this first:

  1. Open the Browser Access Service Settings:

    • On the server, go to SAP Business One Service Manager.

    • Select Browser Access Service from the dropdown.

    • Click Settings.

  2. In the â€œHost Nameâ€ field, make sure itâ€™s set to the serverâ€™s actual name or IP address, not localhost.

  • Save and restart the Browser Access Service.

Verify the correct PORT is open and reachable:

The default Browser Access dispatcher port is typically 8100 or 8443, depending on your setup.

Test from a client system:

  • Open Command Prompt on the userâ€™s PC and run:

     
    ping <ServerName>

    (If ping fails, thereâ€™s a name resolution or network issue.)

  • Then check if the port is reachable:

     
    telnet <ServerName> <Port>

    or

     
    Test-NetConnection <ServerName> -Port <Port>

    (in PowerShell)

If this test fails, your issue is almost certainly firewall or port binding

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Replication Mode in Com...
entry.content:
Hello Simon,

I'll just share my thoughts with you. From my understanding you first set the parameter to I (Initial Replication) in the communication arrangement to let the system know that you want to do an initial load. This by itself does not replicate anything yet. Then you can trigger the initial load in the app Replicate by Replication Model where you choose initial load again. If I understand correctly, that also means if you have the communication arrangement set to C and you want to run an initial load from the Replicate by Replication Model App, it does not work. But it's only from the top of my head, I didn't verify this right now. If this is incorrect, please let me know.

After that you would change the communication arrangement to C (Change Replication) so that changes will be captured. With output mode D (Direct Replication) the changes will be replicated directly and with output mode P (Pooled Replication) the changes will be gathered and the replication will be triggered later by a batch job. For that you have to maintain the job execution settings for the replication model in the communication arrangement.

 

In this guide at page 28 you can find some explanations for the basic settings in the communication arrangement 6KO_Set-Up_EN_XX.pdf

and here in 7. d. is some basic information about the output modes SAP-Help 

Kind regards,

Niklas

Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to add a new admin task to the Manage My Timeshee...
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

 

In order to create a new administrative timesheet task please see the following SAP Help Documentation Manage Your Tasks: "Non-Project Related Task Types: You can define task types that do not refer to a specific project like administration tasks or training, in your configuration environment in activity SSCUI 101864 - Specify Task Types, Components, and Levels. You can disable a task type for either internal employees or contingent workers by changing the values in the Task Type Relevance. If a configuration expert disables a task type for internal employees or contingent workers, further modifications cannot be made to the existing data in the timesheet for that task type. Timesheets for such task types can be made only if the task types are once again made available to internal employees or contingent workers.".

 

Many thanks,

entry.title: Re: project valuation class does not work
entry.content:
Hi friend,
Actually, the issue is that the system did not recognize the project-specific valuation class (QKLAS) during MIGO because the valuation type was not properly determined or assigned for the WBS element. You must follow below mentioned points to investigate why it's not determined.

1. Valuation Type Determination
SAP uses the valuation type to differentiate between standard and project valuation classes. If the valuation type is not explicitly maintained or determined during the PO or GR process, the system defaults to the standard valuation class (BKLAS). Please check the valuation type linked to the WBS element in the project definition? If not, the system wonâ€™t switch to QKLAS.

2. Split Valuation Configuration
For project valuation to work, the material must be set up for split valuation. Look into the material master, is split valuation active? Is the valuation category (e.g., â€˜Projectâ€™) assigned? If split valuation isnâ€™t active, SAP cannot differentiate between standard and project stock.

3. Valuation Class Mapping in OBYC
OBYC-BSX must have separate accounts for each valuation class. Are both BKLAS and QKLAS mapped correctly in OBYC under BSX? If QKLAS is missing or misconfigured, the system may default to BKLAS.

4. Account Assignment Category Q Behavior
When using account assignment category Q (project), SAP expects a WBS element with valuated stock. Is the WBS element flagged for valuated stock in the project system? If not, SAP treats it as non-valuated and uses standard valuation.

5. PO and GR Settings
During PO creation, the valuation type should be selectable or defaulted based on the WBS. Was the valuation type field visible and filled in ME21N? If not, it may need to be enabled via configuration. During MIGO, if the valuation type is not editable or defaulted incorrectly, the GR will post to the wrong account.

Following are my recomendations mentioned below.
Enable split valuation for the material and assign valuation category.
Assign valuation type to WBS element in the project definition.
Ensure OBYC-BSX has correct GL accounts for both BKLAS and QKLAS.
Check PO and GR screens to ensure valuation type is visible and correctly defaulted.
Test with a new PO after correcting the above to confirm correct account posting.

Hope your issue can be fixed with above actions.

entry.title: How to get a list of standard Fiori applications that are extended in the system?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a requirement to identify if any standard SAP Fiori applications in our system have been extended or enhanced.

Is there any  way to get a list of standard Fiori apps that have been extended in S/4HANA?

We are looking for a reliable method to check which standard apps have been customized, either on the frontend or backend side.

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Re: eDocument SII â€“ Canceled invoice before submission does not generate â€œacceptedâ€ status
entry.content:
Good day!

Dear customer, to answer your question, I will need some clarifications.

Regular submission process (let's take 1 document for example) is the following:

  1. You create an Accounting document (using FB01, for example)
  2. You run a eDoc creation report ESSII_EDOCCREATE - Create eDocuments for SII (Spain). Spain SII eDocument is created and is visible in eDocument Cockpit
  3. You run a eDoc List creation report ESSII_EDOCLIST - Create eDoc Lists for SII (Spain). Spain SII List eDocument is created and is visible in eDocument Cockpit.
  4. You submit this List eDocument to Tax Authorities and recieve their response (Accepted or Rejected). Both List and individual eDocuments statuses are updated.

When you describe your situation, what do you cancel? Individual eDocument or actual SAP Accounting documents? And when does that happen, after the individual eDocument is created or after List is created?

entry.title: SAP for Me for Partners - Recent Updates to the Customer Success Dashboard
entry.content:
Dear Partners,

We are excited to announce the release of new features in the Customer Success dashboard in SAP for Me.

Projects Tab:

Global Project View for Partner Groups

Partners who are part if a Partner Grouping Agreement (PGA) can have visibility on all projects across the partner group in the Customer Cloud Projects card. This supports partners who are involved in multi-county implementations to have full transparency on the project delivery across countries. Partner group-level visibility provides partners with a comprehensive view of all projects across their affiliated entities, reducing fragmentation and improving oversight.

To access this view, select the â€œGlobal Viewâ€

 

Clean Core Quality Gate Status

Partners can now have visibility to the status of customerâ€™s Clean Core Quality Gate status for S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition projects via the Customer Cloud Projects card. Clean Core Quality Gates are checkpoints at the end of Prepare (QG1), Explore (QG2), Realize (QG3) and the beginning of Run (QG5), designed to ensure that projectâ€™s clean core principles and project tasks adhere to best practices and quality standards.  The complete status indicates the Q-gate is completed in Cloud ALM, clean core report is generated via CQC service and delivered to customer in their Cloud ALM instance.  All QGs need to be completed for new implementation; QG5 is required for Lift & Shift.Refer to this guide (link) to learn more about Clean Core Projects.

 

Project Manager Maintenance

Project managers are crucial for successful customer projects. Weâ€™ve added a feature in SAP for Me to let partner search and assign a user as project manager when they register a new project.  This information allows closer alignment between the Partners and SAP teams.  The Project Manager contact is also visible on the Customer Cloud Projects Card.

Renewals Tab:

New Renewal Forecast card

We have introduced a new Renewal Forecast card to support partners with their renewals and churn management. In this new card, partners have visibility to renewal opportunities with renewal date within the current quarter and the next four quarters. Partners can switch views to identify renewal opportunities with missing forecast and renewal opportunities with less than 50% probability. Partners can also easily navigate to the Deal Manager from the card to update the opportunities.

View Upcoming Renewals for the current quarter and the next 4 quarters:

 

View Upcoming Renewals for the current quarter and the next quarter:

View Renewals with Forecast Missing:

Renewals with less than 50% Probability:

If you would like to suggest a new feature for SAP for Me, please access here. Your feedback matters and supports to shape the roadmap for SAP for Me for Partner.

entry.title: Re: Customer downpayment in S4HC â€“ temporary workaround for Hungary
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
We have a problem on the accounts payable side. We receive down payment requests that do not entitle us to deduct input tax. We have to pay these gross, but we are not allowed to show the tax until we have received an invoice. We therefore post the down payment request without tax and start the payment run for the down payment. When we have received the down payment invoice, we cancel the posting of the down payment request and then post the down payment invoice with tax shown. Is there a process with which the posting can be carried out correctly?
Thank you very much for your support.

The REST API for this service works and I can query the messages, so all the functionality I need is there. I was just wondering if there is a dashboard somewhere and how can I find it.

entry.title: Re: Recurring Inspection Lot error in SAP QM
entry.content:
Hi,
What I understand that the stock is not moving to Quality Inspection and the missing Inspection Lot Stock tab in QA07 are likely due to configuration or master data issuesâ€”especially with inspection type 09 and batch settings.

Stock Not moving
Inspection Lot Creation Timing
In QA07, recurring inspection lots are created based on the next inspection date and the lead time. If the batch expiration or next inspection date is not within the opening period defined in QA07, the lot won't be created.

Inspection Type 09 Configuration
Ensure that inspection type 09 is activated in the material master under the QM view. The control indicator â€œStock transfer at inspection lot creationâ€ must be set to move stock from unrestricted to quality inspection.

Batch Master Data
The batch must have a valid next inspection date and shelf life data maintained in the material master (Plant Data/Storage 1 view). If these are missing or incorrect, the system wonâ€™t trigger the inspection lot or stock movement.

QA07 Parameters
In QA07, check the parameter â€œTransfer to inspection stockâ€: If set to â€œAt inspection date,â€ stock wonâ€™t move until that date. If set to â€œAt lot creation,â€ stock should move immediatelyâ€”make sure this is selected.


Stock tab missing in QA07
No Stock Posted to the Lot
If no stock was moved to Quality Inspection, the tab wonâ€™t appear because thereâ€™s nothing to post or decide on.

Inspection Lot Origin
For recurring inspections (origin 09), if the stock isnâ€™t batch-managed or the lot isnâ€™t linked to a batch with stock, the tab may not be relevant.

Lot Status
Check the status of the inspection lot in QA03. If itâ€™s not â€œRELâ€ (Released) or doesnâ€™t have stock assigned, the tab wonâ€™t show.

Hope you can find the reason for both of the issues. if fixed please confirm.

entry.title: Re: I can't select a user when creating a Professional Se...
entry.content:
Hello Akira Matsuda,

Generally, the system proposes the logged-in User as the Project Manager, but this can be changed by the project creator.

Could you confirm that the Workforce data (worker and work agreement) is correctly maintained for this logged-in user? Specifically, have the Worker and work agreement assignments been correctly done to the corresponding company code and cost centre?

Missing or incorrect Worker data for the logged-in user could be the reason why the Project Manager field is empty.

Kind Regards

Harish Gour

entry.title: Re: Error in Maintain PIRs when Uploading (Stuck in Loading)
entry.content:
This issue is due the incorrect file format (for example, if you want to add quantity 1000 and in the file, you used 1,000 which is incorrect because of comma) make sure that the format should not be changed.
It is always important to ensure that the format of standard template should not be changed.
 
Please download a new template to try to upload the file again with correct format.

entry.title: Re: Report related to stock retained period.
entry.content:
Good day @yKim

Thank you for your question.

You can consult the following references for further details.

Batch Management, Material Documents Overview & Batch Information Cockpit.

In summary, the public cloud does not provide standard field that directly displays the â€œdays since last goods receiptâ€. However, the system provides you supported options such as:

  • Making use of the Manage Batch Information Cockpit app. This enables you review the last goods receipt date for each batch.
  • The â€œMaterials Overviewâ€ app helps you use the movement type 101 to track GR posting.
  • You can also make use Custom Analytical Query to create a calculated field to enable you dynamically display elapsed days.
  • Finally, the Shelf-Life Management option enables the use of expiration tracking for time-sensitive materials.

I recommend the clean-core approach where you build a Custom Analytical Query. You can use I_MaterialDocumentItem or I_Batch as your data source and add a calculated field for â€œDays Since GRâ€. This will ensure you comply with public cloud extensibility standards.

 

Below is a guidance.

In your Tenant, search for Batch Information Cockpit app.

Filter for your target Material, relevant batch number. Select the batch details view and confirm last goods receipt date field. Save and preview the results. You will see a calculated â€œDays Since GRâ€ column.

You can optionally use Custom Analytical Query to add DaysSinceGR= CurrentDate-LastGoodsReceiptDate as a formular.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP IBP Ratio calculations across different planning...
entry.content:
Hi Mark,

 

Looks like you want to calculate the ratio dynamically, based on the planning level displayed.

To achieve this you will need to define the calculation at request level, eg RATIO@REQUEST = IF ( "SHIPPED@REQUEST" = 0 OR ISNULL ("SHIPPED@REQUEST"), NULL, REQUESTQTY@REQUEST/SHIPPED@REQUEST)
